blog.name: crratbc
blog.title: Center for Retirement Research at Boston College
blog.description: Recognized by the New York Times as “…the nation’s leading center on retirement studies,” our research covers any issue affecting individuals’ income in retirement.  Our main areas are: Social Security, state and local pensions, health and long-term care, financing retirement, and older workers.

blog.name: squaredawayblog
blog.title: Squared Away Blog
blog.description:
Long-time Boston Globe econ/finance reporter Kim Blanton blogs about financial behavior, psychology, education, US $$ culture -- for young and old. Sponsored by the Center for Retirement Research at Boston College.

http://squaredawayblog.bc.edu/

Twitter: @SquaredAwayBC

summary: HCSM News ~ In sickness and in health: Battling Parkinson's as a couple
title: HCSM News ~ In sickness and in health: Battling Parkinson's as a couple
body:
For the Caves of Corner Brook and the Coffeys of Gander, Parkinson’s has left them with only one option: keep going.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/parkinsons-diagnosis-family-impact-1.5101576?cmp=rss

summary: Interview Michael McCastle : World Record Holder
title: Interview Michael McCastle : World Record Holder
body:
Terry Asher:

We are right here with my friend Michael McCastle, Michael exactly how did you get started as an endurance athlete?

Endurance is synonymous with survival. If you could endure discomfort and discover how to welcome it then you can survive anything. Every person has their own trip in life– mine focuses on my limitations as well as pushing beyond them.

Being able to withstand discomfort is important to the success of any kind of fantastic quest or even the worst of tornados could be overcome by endurance. Like most people, I delight in raising heavy weights and being torn, yet it had not been up until I started handling these ultra-endurance challenges for charity that I started to uncover that I really was– what Michael McCastle is really made of.

’ I will not locate that out by sitting around viewing Netflix.’

The decisions I made in mile 9 of a 13-mile hefty tire flip, or 3000 pull-ups into a 24-hour record effort has actually formed the male I am today in all elements of my life, and also has actually educated me lessons in failure, humbleness, and also magnificence. In that respect, being an endurance professional athlete was much less of an option for me as well as even more of a requirement in meeting my life’s objective and also the outcome of the selections I have actually created myself.

On the flip side, if you read this, you have made it through whatever in your life up to this point– that as well makes you an “endurance professional athlete” in your very own right.

Terry Asher:

What would you say to someone looking to enter ending up being an endurance athlete?

If you desire to be an endurance athlete, the first point you need to do is inspect your feelings at the door.

Emotions in endurance training will certainly lead you to believe that it’s the “discomfort” that is quiting you when in truth it your action to the experience of discomfort or anything unfavorable for that issue. I’m not stating neglect injury– train smart– yet understand that if you are honest with on your own, you’ll realize that you typically aren’t passing away and also you CONTAINER maintain going. You are solid sufficient. You are exactly what you believe. Favorable thoughts generate positive results and if you tell yourself something sufficient, ultimately you’ll begin to think it– your belief dictate your behavior.

Terry Asher:

How did you change from being an endurance athlete to a philanthropist or what came first?

I assume they came hand in hand. My endurance occasions have actually constantly been owned by charitable reasons. It gives me objective as well as aids understand the discomfort linked with the training, prep work, and also execution of these challenges.

My choice to do them is partly assisted by my faith in humanity’s potential forever and ability to be even greater. It has constantly been my vision to stay in a globe where that possibility was exceeded.

I believe that my labors are small motions towards inspiring that reality.

Terry Asher:

Why did you develop the twelve labor tasks and also just what have you been able to achieve?

Inspired by the mythical 12 labors of Hercules, I produced Twelve Labors Job as an umbrella under which I can express my interest for health and fitness while inspiring people to seek their very own success despite how seemingly difficult it may be. It is owned by a charitable objective. I’ve located, in my experience, that a guy can never ever be too tired or starving if his reason is more than his own life as well as there is no strength that is higher than the stamina discovered in service to those in need.

So far I’ve accomplished 4 from 12 Labors for numerous philanthropic reasons that have actually consisted of a 50k run while wearing a 40lb vest, a globe document 24-hour pull-up difficulty, a 13 mile 250 lb tire flip, and also a 29,029 feet rope climb that amounted to the height of Mt. Everest.

Terry Asher:

How can the messaging of your brand support his/her fitness and health goals?

I believe Twelve Labors Job advertises positivity and also health in a person’s body and mind, starting with the self-belief that anything is feasible with the best state of mind. It motivates individuals to tip out of their comfort area and also established goals regardless of the perception of trouble, fear, question or the unidentified. Being healthy as well as fit is a way of living that needs commitment, focus, consistency and the ideal mindset. I think Twelve Labors Project embodies every one of those things.

Terry Asher:

Can you provide us a quick description of your crazy achievement of 5,804 pull-ups in 24 Hr? What was undergoing your head throughout that challenge?

Last September I broke the Guinness Globe Document for the most pull-ups completed in a 24 hour period– while using a 30lb pack that represented the physical and also psychological problem of our country’s injured veterans.

I’ll put it this method … I’m 6’ 1 as well as 220lbs– raising just my bodyweight that lot of times was comparable to drawing up 8 space capsule in weight. With the extra weight tossed on top of that, it goes without saying, it was one of one of the most agonizing points I have ever endured.

Honestly, throughout that difficulty and others like it, my mind has to go to a dark location. You have to block every little thing out as well as concentrate just on today moment. Because minute, there is no past, future or end goal. There was only one point in my mind on repeat as well as that was “one even more representative”.

Terry Asher:

I make certain everybody below at gymjunkies is questioning the obviously doubt just what is your typical workout routine?

There really is no “regular” in my training. I’m still active in the Navy as well as I’m also seeking my masters so my workouts fit about my job and institution schedule. With that claimed, I securely believe that there are 24-HOUR in a day so if I miss a training session, I have only myself to blame.

There are no reasons, just time and possibility, even if that indicates missing an hour or two of sleep or bringing my books with me to the health club and reviewing a phase in between workouts. Keeping that claimed, if I’m training for an occasion, I intend to train two times a day 5-6 days a week and it normally contains endurance training in the early morning where I’ll go with a long swim in the pool or ocean anywhere from 2-3 miles or a future that could range in between 8 to 12 miles.

I do some kind of weightlifting at nights as well as it typically includes a high quantity of hefty, compound lifts like Romanian Deadlifts, Squats, and also Expenses Presses as well as heavy pull-ups followed by a series of exercises or event certain movements that I typically do to failing toward completion. When I was educating for the pull-up difficulty, I did up to 1500 pull-ups at the end of a lot of sessions.

I also educate core daily for 15-20 minutes in some shape or form. When I’m not in the weight area, I’m outdoors. Given that a lot of my events put me amongst the elements, the nastier it is outdoors, the much better. It forces me to concentrate on the points I can control which is not the weather.

It advises me to constantly be stronger than my atmosphere. Staying in the Pacific Northwest, I take advantage of the nearby mountains as well as beaches where I drag as well as turn heavy, water-laden logs backwards and forwards the coastline or climb tops with my weighted ruck sack.

Terry Asher:

What did your diet plan include when you are training?

I take in 4500-6000 calories each day, depending upon exactly what I have actually intended to do. It is composed of a lot lean protein, mainly from fish as well as various other whole food resources of veggies, carbs and crucial fats. I eat tidy essentially however in no way do I restrict myself from enjoying foods I such as when I seem like consuming them. I’m taking a look at you, gummy bears.

Terry Asher:

Tell us regarding your brand-new project that will assist bring more understanding to expert self-destruction:

On May 22nd, I will certainly enter into Fatality Valley as well as pull a 2.2-ton vehicle 22 miles to raise recognition for Veteran Suicide. The number 22 is necessary since on standard, 22 experts dedicate suicide every day. Death Valley stands for the mind of those affected by PTSD and also depression.

The feat represents wish for healing. Our country’s professionals are dealing with a quiet enemy in an unnoticeable war– one in which they are not adequately geared up to fight. This requires a nationwide conversation that I hope to draw recognition to with this event.

Terry Asher:

Anything you wish to include for us here at Gymjunkies?

For my next labor, I have partnered with several of the country’s leading professional self-destruction prevention and also advocacy companies with the goal of getting 10,000 people to promise $1 for each mile of the truck pull. 100% of funds increased will certainly go to programs and campaigns specifically developed to deal with veteran self-destruction and reduce the disturbing trend of 22 each day. If you would certainly such as to add to the fight, browse through www.anython.com/22

-Terry Asher

P.S Allowed’s assistance Michael McCastle elevate awareness to professional self-destruction avoidance, comment below for your support!

We are right here with my friend Michael McCastle, Michael exactly how did you get started as an endurance athlete?

Being able to withstand discomfort is important to the success of any kind of fantastic quest or even the worst of tornados could be overcome by endurance. Like most people, I delight in raising heavy weights and being torn, yet it had not been up until I started handling these ultra-endurance challenges for charity that I started to uncover that I really was– what Michael McCastle is really made of.

’ I will not locate that out by sitting around viewing Netflix.’

The decisions I made in mile 9 of a 13-mile hefty tire flip, or 3000 pull-ups into a 24-hour record effort has actually formed the male I am today in all elements of my life, and also has actually educated me lessons in failure, humbleness, and also magnificence. In that respect, being an endurance professional athlete was much less of an option for me as well as even more of a requirement in meeting my life’s objective and also the outcome of the selections I have actually created myself.

On the flip side, if you read this, you have made it through whatever in your life up to this point– that as well makes you an “endurance professional athlete” in your very own right.

Terry Asher:

What would you say to someone looking to enter ending up being an endurance athlete?

If you desire to be an endurance athlete, the first point you need to do is inspect your feelings at the door.

Emotions in endurance training will certainly lead you to believe that it’s the “discomfort” that is quiting you when in truth it your action to the experience of discomfort or anything unfavorable for that issue. I’m not stating neglect injury– train smart– yet understand that if you are honest with on your own, you’ll realize that you typically aren’t passing away and also you CONTAINER maintain going. You are solid sufficient. You are exactly what you believe. Favorable thoughts generate positive results and if you tell yourself something sufficient, ultimately you’ll begin to think it– your belief dictate your behavior.

Terry Asher:

How did you change from being an endurance athlete to a philanthropist or what came first?

I assume they came hand in hand. My endurance occasions have actually constantly been owned by charitable reasons. It gives me objective as well as aids understand the discomfort linked with the training, prep work, and also execution of these challenges.

My choice to do them is partly assisted by my faith in humanity’s potential forever and ability to be even greater. It has constantly been my vision to stay in a globe where that possibility was exceeded.

I believe that my labors are small motions towards inspiring that reality.

Terry Asher:

Why did you develop the twelve labor tasks and also just what have you been able to achieve?

Inspired by the mythical 12 labors of Hercules, I produced Twelve Labors Job as an umbrella under which I can express my interest for health and fitness while inspiring people to seek their very own success despite how seemingly difficult it may be. It is owned by a charitable objective. I’ve located, in my experience, that a guy can never ever be too tired or starving if his reason is more than his own life as well as there is no strength that is higher than the stamina discovered in service to those in need.

So far I’ve accomplished 4 from 12 Labors for numerous philanthropic reasons that have actually consisted of a 50k run while wearing a 40lb vest, a globe document 24-hour pull-up difficulty, a 13 mile 250 lb tire flip, and also a 29,029 feet rope climb that amounted to the height of Mt. Everest.

Terry Asher:

How can the messaging of your brand support his/her fitness and health goals?

I believe Twelve Labors Job advertises positivity and also health in a person’s body and mind, starting with the self-belief that anything is feasible with the best state of mind. It motivates individuals to tip out of their comfort area and also established goals regardless of the perception of trouble, fear, question or the unidentified. Being healthy as well as fit is a way of living that needs commitment, focus, consistency and the ideal mindset. I think Twelve Labors Project embodies every one of those things.

Terry Asher:

Can you provide us a quick description of your crazy achievement of 5,804 pull-ups in 24 Hr? What was undergoing your head throughout that challenge?

Last September I broke the Guinness Globe Document for the most pull-ups completed in a 24 hour period– while using a 30lb pack that represented the physical and also psychological problem of our country’s injured veterans.

I’ll put it this method … I’m 6’ 1 as well as 220lbs– raising just my bodyweight that lot of times was comparable to drawing up 8 space capsule in weight. With the extra weight tossed on top of that, it goes without saying, it was one of one of the most agonizing points I have ever endured.

Honestly, throughout that difficulty and others like it, my mind has to go to a dark location. You have to block every little thing out as well as concentrate just on today moment. Because minute, there is no past, future or end goal. There was only one point in my mind on repeat as well as that was “one even more representative”.

Terry Asher:

I make certain everybody below at gymjunkies is questioning the obviously doubt just what is your typical workout routine?

There really is no “regular” in my training. I’m still active in the Navy as well as I’m also seeking my masters so my workouts fit about my job and institution schedule. With that claimed, I securely believe that there are 24-HOUR in a day so if I miss a training session, I have only myself to blame.

There are no reasons, just time and possibility, even if that indicates missing an hour or two of sleep or bringing my books with me to the health club and reviewing a phase in between workouts. Keeping that claimed, if I’m training for an occasion, I intend to train two times a day 5-6 days a week and it normally contains endurance training in the early morning where I’ll go with a long swim in the pool or ocean anywhere from 2-3 miles or a future that could range in between 8 to 12 miles.

I do some kind of weightlifting at nights as well as it typically includes a high quantity of hefty, compound lifts like Romanian Deadlifts, Squats, and also Expenses Presses as well as heavy pull-ups followed by a series of exercises or event certain movements that I typically do to failing toward completion. When I was educating for the pull-up difficulty, I did up to 1500 pull-ups at the end of a lot of sessions.

I also educate core daily for 15-20 minutes in some shape or form. When I’m not in the weight area, I’m outdoors. Given that a lot of my events put me amongst the elements, the nastier it is outdoors, the much better. It forces me to concentrate on the points I can control which is not the weather.

It advises me to constantly be stronger than my atmosphere. Staying in the Pacific Northwest, I take advantage of the nearby mountains as well as beaches where I drag as well as turn heavy, water-laden logs backwards and forwards the coastline or climb tops with my weighted ruck sack.

Terry Asher:

What did your diet plan include when you are training?

I take in 4500-6000 calories each day, depending upon exactly what I have actually intended to do. It is composed of a lot lean protein, mainly from fish as well as various other whole food resources of veggies, carbs and crucial fats. I eat tidy essentially however in no way do I restrict myself from enjoying foods I such as when I seem like consuming them. I’m taking a look at you, gummy bears.

Terry Asher:

Tell us regarding your brand-new project that will assist bring more understanding to expert self-destruction:

On May 22nd, I will certainly enter into Fatality Valley as well as pull a 2.2-ton vehicle 22 miles to raise recognition for Veteran Suicide. The number 22 is necessary since on standard, 22 experts dedicate suicide every day. Death Valley stands for the mind of those affected by PTSD and also depression.

The feat represents wish for healing. Our country’s professionals are dealing with a quiet enemy in an unnoticeable war– one in which they are not adequately geared up to fight. This requires a nationwide conversation that I hope to draw recognition to with this event.

Terry Asher:

Anything you wish to include for us here at Gymjunkies?

For my next labor, I have partnered with several of the country’s leading professional self-destruction prevention and also advocacy companies with the goal of getting 10,000 people to promise $1 for each mile of the truck pull. 100% of funds increased will certainly go to programs and campaigns specifically developed to deal with veteran self-destruction and reduce the disturbing trend of 22 each day. If you would certainly such as to add to the fight, browse through www.anython.com/22

-Terry Asher

P.S Allowed’s assistance Michael McCastle elevate awareness to professional self-destruction avoidance, comment below for your support!

summary:
Made it to the gym today offically making it a month since James ane I started our goal to be more active.
As long as we showed...
body:
Made it to the gym today offically making it a month since James ane I started our goal to be more active.

As long as we showed up we called it a success, and so far we have had a 100% perfect success rate every time. We’ve designated Tues, Thurs, and Sun as our active days (we do stuff in between of course but those days are intentional and mandatory). Sometimes we work out 30minutes, sometimes an hour, sometimes we just go for a nice walk or goof around with a soccer ball.

I see a lot of stuff on Tumblr about routines, progress, or always making sure you get that sweat. And yet I see so many people who feel dissapointed from their workouts, themselves, and by the lack of results. That sort of fitness culture just isn’t realistic for most people. My advice for people looking to get healthy: Make your goals small, achieve them, and celebrate every one.

I’d love to hear some of your health goals and stories! Where are you at? Where do you wanna be? What are you proud of now?

~ ☀

summary: HCSM News ~ Cannabis, smartphones and mental illness: How workplace health and safety is changing
title: HCSM News ~ Cannabis, smartphones and mental illness: How workplace health and safety is changing
body:
For years, workplace health and safety was all about preventing physical harm to employees on the job, but an annual conference in Mississauga this week will tackle mental health issues brought on by things like smartphone use and the legalization of cannabis.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/workplace-health-and-safety-toronto-1.5115833?cmp=rss

As much progress as we’ve made in society when it comes to abuse and mental health stigma, it seems like there will always be a story like this one around to remind us why it’s not always going to be safe for people to be open about their mental health struggles.

summary: Top 20 Big 12 2020 NFL Draft Prospects to Watch https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
title: Top 20 Big 12 2020 NFL Draft Prospects to Watch https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
description:
The Big 12 has been the butt of jokes for years around the NFL draft. That might have changed in 2019.

The offense-heavy conference had 26 players selected in this year’s draft, an average of 2.6 players per team. While that trailed the SEC’s NFL factory (4.6 picks per team), it put the Big 12 in line with the Big Ten (2.9) and Pac-12 (2.8). Meanwhile, with just two draft picks per team, the ACC brought up the rear this year among power conferences.


Read the full story on Athlon Sports

summary: Top 25 SEC 2020 NFL Draft Prospects to Watch https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
title: Top 25 SEC 2020 NFL Draft Prospects to Watch https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
description:
The 2019 NFL Draft is now officially in the books. And for the 13th consecutive year, the SEC flexed its muscle with more players selected than any other conference in college football. The SEC boasted a total of 64 players selected by NFL teams over the three-day event in Nashville, including 22 taken in the first two rounds alone. To put the SEC’s dominance into perspective, the Big Ten was second with 40.
Read the full story on Athlon Sports

summary: It’s been a learning experience for me to work with Developing Indigenous Resource’s (DIR) health promoters. They take care of...
caption:
It’s been a learning experience for me to work with Developing Indigenous Resource’s (DIR) health promoters. They take care of primary healthcare, nutrition improvement, health education and providing vitamin supplements to more than 17000 women and children in Naya Gaon basti of Chandigarh. DIR has trained the young girls and women from the basti only. Now the people in basti call them doctor madam. It is one of the most successful public health programs on ground with daily monitoring of health of women and children in basti. DIR need your support. You can visit DIR, volunteer here and provide monetary support. I visited DIR to understand and cover the benefits of Vitamin A for children and Multi Vitamin supplement for pregnant women provided by @vitaminangels
#photographyforactivism #activismthroughphotography #publichealth
#health #womenhealth #childrenhealth #nutrition #vitamins #vitamina #chandigarh #society #healthactivist #pregnancydiary #malnutrition #primaryhealthcare #storiesofindia #mytravel #p3top #volunteers #yourshotphotographer #reportagespotlight #everydayindia #communityhealth #instagram (at Chandigarh)
